01495DDDFE604189978B5186620E6825.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

B0DA4CDC13CB45E4A381869591AE583A.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer.

B4769384199149F8B9F8F6636A435DF1.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

5D5D7EBE977D4DFB95E477DD4AE8683A.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

A093C9858D99451CBD19E39B89AA5C99.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

65A4CE9EA6D64CFFAC220A334A1AC29B.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

007C21F6F80C40269967078CF101C01F.description: Document knowledge and awareness of labour standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

2DC708A2D21D4581A09C5AF9026CC047.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

3E0995E4B98448028AD35867309BE71F.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

73492AB8C10E46228E342554A837C823.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

1FF5909233E643BFA72A4EE2E44786C5.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

7CE159D9BF3C482D8ECBC26E5CF9E1EB.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

DDA4060AB4AA471992EC53A7F767C7E9.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

C1EF9E85D23C4C10AB0FEC1B1226F312.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

345115C5DAED497F8611ED0E2E66321D.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

314B76FA435446B490EED8EC05B7125A.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution.

C10DC495A7C44EEB85068175154056E7.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

494256E3274243E8ADE5BB105057130C.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

F4EC5931A76A41D99284034BB834512C.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

E7CA9E9F0B5A47678686AC4E6CAC07A9.description: Maintain a clean and organized work area when performing automotive diagnosis and repair.

8A5AB0AEB73146BFB6DBA86F2D8B37A7.description: Identify and demonstrate appropriate safety procedures when performing automotive diagnosis and repair.

ACAEC13C89A74A9CA30FF6E024DC31A6.description: Prepare a work order that summarizes the diagnostic process.

A94496BB9A094E0F93EC7BEFF5D23098.description: Propose an approximate time frame for the diagnostic process.

275938A0C4B049209A10F5712B3B0AEF.description: Identify required components, and compile a parts list and cost estimate for a repair or modification process.

87E891CB674C48619BC737289FE1F9D2.description: Follow appropriate processes to complete installations or modifications.

0533F91E76AB49DDB0C3893A8E254444.description: Use appropriate service information to identify proper repair processes.

93D650B89DFB4FC9A500B3A8A345DE56.description: Follow logical diagnostic processes to identify, diagnose, repair and confirm the repair.

E54970CE48D345378F907F1C0EB0B65D.description: Perform basic automotive and mechanical repairs, installations, and/or modifications.

3295C4D6BCBF4DFF99BDABBF802ED0C6.description: Diagnose and perform automatic transmissions repairs, such as transmission flushing, changing transmission filter and pan gasket, inspecting and clearing venting, adjusting linkages and removing and reinstalling the transmission.

367DB2AD84B24DD8A52F149A4723F8BD.description: Identify common symptoms and faults associated with automatic transmissions.

B749EA7C5C4E455C96A81DA92DEA8D3A.description: Describe the operation of an automatic transmission in terms of its components (e.g., torque converter, clutches and bands and planetary gear sets).

A2E37BF42E3D47F0ABCA599289BB7D4B.description: Explain the purpose and function of automatic transmissions.

6126D8BB615147E7B0F94C9FDCE4897F.description: Demonstrate proper procedures for disposal of used transmission oil and explain potential environmental concerns associated with disposal of transmission oil.

D242C43B18C347EBA2F087D35B989A58.description: Identify and follow safe work practices (e.g., lift and support components properly and be aware of component weight and pinch points) when working with automatic transmissions, including maintaining a clean and organized work area.

EFA18E1B5D4A45E19AD0E1CAEA68C229.description: Diagnose, service and repair automatic transmissions.

EE6283AD08C847A683206509C4ED4A2F.description: Diagnose and perform manual transmission repairs (e.g., remove and replace transmission/transaxle, inspect and clear transmission vents and change oil).

2C0EBF398D9F4B69842D680B14BA2D1E.description: Identify common symptoms and faults associated with manual transmissions.

E8AE0EFB7447443B8B95CCEA37694D0A.description: Calculate gear ratios and identify power flow through manual transmissions for all forward and reverse gears.

6C4D76EB9AE342208CDD2002BB6710C2.description: Explain the construction and operation of manual transmission gearing, including synchromesh.

B4026F34F96A4DC4B3186A9576647C49.description: Explain the purpose and function of manual transmissions.

D4253AC19ED0487F8C68485A8252BAE7.description: Demonstrate the proper procedures for disposal of used transmission oil and explain potential environmental concerns associated with disposal of transmission oil.

82C44C2C804743C197E5FBAF58E72D13.description: Identify and follow safe work practices (e.g. lift and support components properly and be aware of component weight and pinch points) when working with manual transmissions, including maintaining a clean and organized work area.

C99DC876D348462D9C30C6C8994BF59F.description: Diagnose, service and repair manual transmissions and transaxles.

EB03BF48081443DFBBE88561C3D303F8.description: Explore how engine modifications can affect engine performance.

927AF142A95A48F5874BE5CA4D147DD7.description: Adjust, repair and/or replace engine components to solve problems and optimize performance.

303303AEACC7478BABCF4217AC9603CE.description: Follow established systematic diagnosis procedures, including visual inspections and diagnostic tests, to identify specific engine problems.

3218C1FB1DE24278887887729AB7BF86.description: Identify and follow safe work practices (e.g., be aware of high voltage shock hazards, pinch points, hot surfaces, sharp surfaces, moving parts and fire hazards) when performing basic engine diagnosis, testing and repair, including maintaining a clean and organized work area.

4D9159E5CC6E4102B938A52F290FC032.description: Perform basic engine diagnosis, testing and repair.

B5852230419A41A09841D860166F239F.description: Define and determine engine measurements such as displacement, compression ratio and clearance.

5BE47F562634416EA80EEE8F58CCCA22.description: Explain the purpose and operation of internal engine components (e.g., camshaft, crankshaft and pistons) and variations (e.g., cam lift, piston shape and ring design) of each component.

6A7C42BAD51F4191B605D6B152F5A6EB.description: Compare the air flow of naturally aspirated and forced air (e.g., supercharged and turbocharged) engines.

AD7148A123434999AD1F06DC3A596279.description: Describe how the events of combustion change with different fuel sources (e.g., diesel, varying octane gasoline and compressed natural gas [CNG]).

923970EED0CE4397B03B3DE387DC88BD.description: Differentiate between common automotive valve train configurations (e.g., cam in block, single overhead camshaft and dual overhead camshaft) in multi-cylinder engines.

302E0A6AD77D441D8FEAD0608DAA8E47.description: Differentiate between common automotive engine configurations (e.g., inline, V-type and opposed).

C031923A08354502BD2786DB0041F4FF.description: Explain the construction and function of major engine sub-assemblies (e.g., cooling, exhaust, lubrication systems) in multi-cylinder engines.

C277DDF265204B1FAE684D45E621E5E1.description: Explain multi-cylinder engine construction and operation.

B9C2C4AE3AC74EE7BDBE60AAEAFCA28D.description: Diagnose and repair common automotive exhaust system faults.

81DCD29873514CBE853199ED6979AB7F.description: Inspect and evaluate exhaust systems for leaks, mounting issues, corrosion, blockage and noise.

98B67F6D992D4CBDA7EF53F9ABD8B857.description: Apply appropriate care and attention when working with fragile exhaust components such as O2 sensors, catalytic converters and ceramics.

97B336758C7B408689E0AA3598BB7891.description: Describe the function and operation of automotive exhaust systems and their components.

C4E136B4C67349BFA676583F4B92F81C.description: Dispose of automotive exhaust system components such as catalytic converters properly.

76CF6434434C44A1AD4D652B359192B3.description: Identify and follow safe work practices (e.g., be aware of hot surfaces and dangers of using pipe bending equipment) when working with automotive exhaust systems, including maintaining a clean and organized work area.

E13947B7117141FE816E4E2E962B06AE.description: Diagnose, service and repair automotive exhaust systems.

A576CB507CF24221ABE99EB413D82620.description: Fill automotive coolant systems according to specifications and purge air from systems where required.

0364A19C424C445E9FCC0EB15CE43804.description: Diagnose and perform common automotive cooling system repairs such as removing and replacing belts, radiator, water pump and thermostat.

6F7B2524B1AF48CEB3D29FA19A2F27A9.description: Perform common cooling system tests (e.g., visual inspection, pressure tests, leak detection and coolant tests) and maintenance procedures (e.g., checking fluid levels and flushing the cooling system).

3EDB2EAE1D9D4336B2E4D5F9BCA73CB8.description: Compare the operation of liquid and air cooling systems.

B2185F5B35074C72B0B0D11B6AFF2721.description: Explain the function of the components of a liquid cooling system.

0FC3553480C1442F8C3D964047BBFC5C.description: Describe how cooling systems remove and dissipate heat from engines, including the role of antifreeze.

C3324DEBE0F64CB19D7CAE8D7FCF1940.description: Demonstrate the proper procedures for disposal of used coolants and explain potential environmental concerns associated with antifreeze disposal.

9FBA2EF7F6864A37AB0CB8564787EA11.description: Identify and follow safe work practices (e.g., check coolant pressure and temperature) when working with automotive cooling systems, including maintaining a clean and organized work area.

6641DE1E47D7490EAA5610145FFED369.description: Diagnose, service and repair automotive cooling systems.

C18918F9CDBE4AF0B7765B285971CBBC.description: Lift and lower vehicles on a hoist in a safe manner using proper procedures.

778A9AD66F794D1480504352C9B294D1.description: Raise large drivetrain assemblies using hoists and transmission jacks.

4164AADC3F86444199F827FD6FC872B5.description: Lift and lower vehicles in a safe manner using floor jacks and jack stands.

BE3E24CE3A56465F88A8FFAF7F98E8BC.description: Position vehicles safely and correctly before lifting.

E61974EB35BE4CA49826E989EBDA6D55.description: Identify lift and balance points for different types of vehicles.

067AB59F33D04B3EBAC78B0416CB0295.description: Identify appropriate lifting and support equipment needed for the task.

7628940A27C44F8B8EBB44BAC3870614.description: Identify and follow appropriate safe practices related to lifting and supporting vehicles, including maintaining a clean and organized work area.

9FC75CB21CB24263AD3953FB8BE79743.description: Demonstrate safe procedures to lift and support vehicles.

91F482759604451799E4FBB4A6721408.description: Recognize and apply safe and fair work practices, including freedom from violence, harassment and bullying.

A5571908BC48420AB5EABF87010E777E.description: Identify, label, store and handle hazardous materials according to Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS 2015).

7ACE3557881F4B3BA1CBE845474BA037.description: Locate, identify and explain the correct use of safety equipment (e.g., eye wash station and first aid station) in the workplace.

CAC5C8C8E8284CA98918D2C1DD2CED59.description: Describe the importance of a clean workplace and methods used to maintain a clean workplace.

B2061DFDCA51415F962C56F0B6475234.description: Identify the correct fire extinguisher for different classifications (i.e., A, B, C, D and K) of fires and how to use the extinguisher correctly (i.e., PASS - Pull Aim Squeeze Sweep).

C458E07EC8914BA5986BE23AD653B3C7.description: Identify potential health concerns when PPE is not used properly.

5C894847B7524F3289D5F27C7E5A2ECD.description: Identify industry standard personal protective equipment (PPE), such as safety goggles, hearing protection, gloves and footwear, and appropriate PPE cleaning procedures.

6D3C075691D64F7C92A26450D8EEB19A.description: Inspect and utilize protective devices on equipment.

60322B51C4B54F908E17CC7AE0A1848A.description: Describe ways to reduce personal injury or material and equipment damage as a result of unsafe work acts or environments.

44E2910F5803466DA72FDFA799F0F9D1.description: Identify the importance of safety when undertaking automotive service procedures, including safety hazards and preventative measures common to the automotive industry.

61CB32000DA9460897BEC8527919E0D9.description: Apply principles and techniques for injury prevention to ensure safety in the automotive workplace.

5981CE9C67114B12B61F51CCA0BF7FDA.description: Automotive Safety Equipment, Hazardous Materials, and Housekeeping Skills (Core)
